item.description:
Whole Cloth, NH Presentation

Admission is FREE

Please pre-register through this Meetup website or by calling Susan Bartlett, Whole Cloth Coordinator, at (603)209-6162.

This hour long program features the lives of the resettled refugee women whose stories are depicted in part, on the Whole Cloth panels which are now on display in the Millyard Museum. The women will tell stories from their lives before, during, and after the genocide which swept central Africa in the mid-1990’s, as well as their lives as refugees and the journey to the United States. Three to five women will present their stories through an interpreter. The audience will be invited to look more closely at artifacts and clothing at the end of the presentation. This presentation is appropriate for adults and high school age students.

This presentation is appropriate for adults and high school age students. This program is presented by Sewing Confidence organized by Rubia, Inc.
item.name: Whole Cloth, NH Presentation
